reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were able to "escape" from our 4 kids for the weekend. Found this resort online and so glad we did! The room was nice and clean. The balcony was very private.Even number floors have the best,most private balconies!! The pool, the bar and the resturant were all great.The buffet breakfast was so good and the price,you can't beat.The service from all areas was the best.We only left the resort once in which to eat out but if had to do again,we would have just stayed there! We have already booked a family vacation.Can't wait to take the kids.They are going to have tons of fun.Plan on staying at the resort the whole time.Ask for Jessica in reservations.Shes a sweetheart!
reviews.title: "HOT" WEEKEND GETAWAY!!!!

reviews.text: My family just returned from a trip at the Ocean Reef Resort in Myrtle Beach. This is an outstanding resort if you have young children. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and found the rooms to be very spacious and we had a great view from our condo. The rooms were clean and the service was excellent! Our children had their choice of the lazy river, choice of several pools or just spending time on the beach. There is also a game room and scheduled children activities for a small fee. I would highly recommend this resort to others. It is a great value for the experience!
reviews.title: Great Value for the Experience

reviews.text: I traveled with my husband, our three boys, 8,4, and 2, and my mother, for a seven night stay. I was very worried about booking a hotel off the internet. I worried until we arrived. I was quickly pleased with the hotel when we arrived. They allowed us to check in early, no charge, because we arrived in town early, and our room was ready. Check in and check out was quick and easy. the rooms were clean. the pool areawas clean. although, all the kids areas have sprinklers and different waterfall type stuff ,which can be a bit much for the little ones, but they still had a blast in it. Four hot tubs provided plenty of chances for use, not that we could. We were in a 1 bedroom condo with an ocean view. we really did have an ocean view , and with the ocean just steps from the hotel, you could just sit and watch people on beach if you wanted. In the room there was a nice washer/dryer and a decent kitchen. Only thing we found missing was a broom. It would have been very useful with my kids. the murphy beds are not good for kids, because they are to high and are above a tile floor. Also, if you have the sofa bed and the murphy bed open there is limited room to move around. Two mornings maids came right before 9 am, while a few people were still sleeping and they were noisy. On the other days we were out when they came. the beach in front of the hotel was clean. And we found tons of great shells washing up. over all our stay there was great.
reviews.title: would stay there again- loaded with info on hotel.

reviews.text: parking was ok most days. And you can park at the meters beside hotel from 7 pm till 9 am for free. on the weekend days though we did have a harder time. But the parking across the street was not bad. If you have a handicap tag bring it. My mom forgot hers or we would have never had a problem parking.
reviews.title: Great condos. Have really enjoyed each...

reviews.text: A few added tips about the area--
reviews.title: Can't wait to return to the Ocean Reef

reviews.text: We stayed in room 1415 from Tues (7/6/2010) thru Friday am.....!! The first day, we checked in and the message light was on, on the phone. Tried to dial out and NOTHING. I called the front desk 3 times (from my cell phone) and was told they'll be right up. After 3 hours wait, I spoke to Will who turned me over to David, the manager. The manager got someone up fast, Joel was his name and he was great. Tried to fix the phone but couldn't do it, even trying a new phone. Then we addressed a 2nd problem, the microwave and coffee pot were sitting on their shelf over the refrigerator, but there was no place to plug them in, unless you lifted them somewhere else. Joel was amazed. There were bugs and the bathroom had the ceiling taped up and all the fixtures had rust, due to the fact that the exhaust fan didn't work. We went by the front desk and told them to fix the problems, and we'd be back after dinner. We came back and Will told us they were going to give us a 5% back on our bill (they had our money in advance). We couldn't move to another room, because there were none.
reviews.title: Pictures Lie....They are lipstick on a pig!!

reviews.text: Part 2 ----you couldn't get a lounge chair by the pool because they were all taken or saved. Many times by people who stayed elsewhere and used the pool and walkway to the beach. I know because I spoke to some of them. The elevators and common areas were soaked with water and you could have had a mishap if you weren't careful. This was my first trip to Myrtle Beach and I went with a friend who had been to MB many times, so he showed me around. I have since looked into better hotels and will not ever return to the Ocean Reef "RESORT"; unless I need to walk to the beach thru their pool areas.
reviews.title: Nice three day beach stay at the ocean reef resort

reviews.text: Part 3 ...........the best thing about Ocean Reef is the great people in the breakfast buffet area. I would even come back just for breakfast. They were very warm and caring.
reviews.title: A little Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our family's first time in Myrtle Beach. We all enjoyed are three day visit. Our two bedroom condo was ample room for the five of us. Everything was clean, and it was nice having a kitchen, washer and dryer. I thought the price was a little high at 350.00 a night, but It was prime season while we were there judging from the crowds. The pool was so crowded that if you didn't get there early in the morning there was no way you could get a pool chair. My children 7 and 4 loved the lazy river, and spent a lot of time floating around in it. I rented two beach chairs and a umbrella on the beach from the life guard for 25.00 a day. You definately need to bring your own beach towels, we didn't bring are own so we had to purchase some while we were in town. The condo was a little bit away from what appeared to be the downtown Myrtle Beach area, but it didn't really end up being a problem. We ate dinner at a good Mexican restaurant a couple of blocks from the resort. There was also plenty of other restaurants close, even walking distance. We went to Broadway on the Boardwalk two evenings while there, which was great. It was also very crowded so I recomment reservations or going early if you are planning on eating dinner at any of the trendy places like Margaritaville. One day we had lunch out side at the outside grill by the pool, and the burgers were good. Overall its a nice family place. It isn't a luxury resort as I was first expected , but a nice place to go with kids. If this had been a romantic weekend get away I think I would have wanted to stay some place more with more luxury, less people, and less noise. Since this was a family vacation with our three children it was great for us this trip.
reviews.title: We had a fantastic time!

reviews.text: We had a great time at the beach but were rather disappointed with the hotel. Yes, the pools were great. It was nice to have an option between a covered pool and one in the sun. The hotel looks like it is in the process of beign upgraded. The common areas were lovely, but our room was just ok. We opted for a room with a kitchenette because we were going to be staying for about a week. I would not cook on those surfaces. The oven was clearly very old and outdated. However the microwave seemed relatively new. The bathroom countertops were nice, but the tub was rather unpleasant. There were old water stains from what appeared to be a leaky faucet. the first time I showered the drain emptied rather slowly. My husband shaved in the sink shortly after and the water somehow gurgled up into the tub. We called maintenance adn two guys were able to fix it. However the tub still drained rather slowly so I ended up standing in a puddle of water while showering. The sink, countertops and flooring appeared to be newer. So it does seem like they are slowly updating the hotle bit by bit.
reviews.title: Don't Stay here if you value Cleanliness!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had a great family fun atmosphere. The staff was extremely nice and we would be excited to visit again.
reviews.title: We had a great stay at the Ocean Reef

reviews.text: My family and I had a great time at this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised to receive an ocean front room. We all had a blast waking up and settling down to the waves hitting the shore. The pools and lazy river were awesome. We only ate once at one of the restaurants because we opted to buy groceries and eat in the room most of the time. However, the one time we did eat at the hotel, it was very good. There was an outdoor bar and grill by the pool that was a nice option too. I would definitely stay here again. Parking was a little tricky at times, but you could park at a public meter on the street next to the hotel at night and as long as you moved your vehicle by 9 am you were fine.
reviews.title: Had a Terrific Stay

reviews.text: This was our third visit to Ocean Reef. Each visit we have stayed in a two-bedroom condo in the north tower, and each time we have had a wonderful stay. The room was beautiful and clean and very comfortable. It felt like coming home since we have stayed there so often. We have been on lower floors in the past and this time we were on the tenth floor. We found the ocean view to be nicer from the higher floor.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay At Ocean Reef

reviews.text: All of the staff was very friendly and the kids enjoyed playing Bingo for one of the kids' activities. We found that the quality of the frozen drinks at the pool bar had improved quite a bit since our last stay. We found ourselves ordering pina coladas most afternoons for ourselves and fruit smoothies for the kids. It was also much simpler to grab a quick lunch by the pool than in past years. You simply place your order at the pool bar and then take your ticket across the sidewalk to the lunch counter and have your lunch in minutes. The food was reasonably priced and very quick and delicious.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: I have seen quite a few complaints on tripadvisor about the parking situation and can't really understand what people are complaining about. We found an open spot in the parking garage every time and the walk to the hotel elevator is probably two minutes at the most. There are numerous parking spaces in surrounding lots that are for Ocean Reef guests as well.
reviews.title: Ocean Reef is an awesome vacation resort for families!

reviews.text: rooms are clean but outdated. front desk employees are rude and unresponsive and basically have no authority to do anything other than take your money and give you a room key. the pool is great but dont plan on getting a chair at pool unless you plan to be at the pool before 9am or after 3pm. the tiki bar was a nice touch but the grill items were way over priced.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed

reviews.text: We had a 3 bedroom condo. Had booked early in the year for our summer vacation and requested a lower level but not the bottom floor. We were throughly satisfied and thrilled when we got the 3rd floor. Room was clean and neat and orderly. The staff was very pleasant. The children loved all the kiddie pools, lazy river and bigger pools. Adults love the hot tubs and beach. This was our 3rd visit to Ocean Reef and most definitely will come back again.
reviews.title: Excellent Place for a Family Vacation with Extended Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you go to Myrtle Beach to relax and play gold go to Ocean Reef Hotel and let Renay D'Elia set up your package----she's fantastic. My wife hasn't played in years and is re-learning the game. Renay set us up with beautiful, "comfortable" courses, and explained to the pros that we wanted to play alone and not be teamed up, etc. She took care of all conditions and set us up in "perfect scenarios." Renay really knows the courses and people involved. She is a real tribute to her hotel and to the golf industry. Thank you Renay.
reviews.title: One person made all the difference and made our vacation great
